Uses of Interface
org.apache.openjpa.persistence.query.QueryDefinition

  • Packages that use QueryDefinition 
    Package Description
    org.apache.openjpa.persistence
    OpenJPA JPA This package provides an JPA facade to OpenJPA.
    org.apache.openjpa.persistence.query
    OpenJPA Dynamic Query This package provides dynamic query construction that are similar to weakly-typed Criteria API.

    • Uses of QueryDefinition in org.apache.openjpa.persistence

      Methods in org.apache.openjpa.persistence with parameters of type QueryDefinition 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OpenJPAQuery OpenJPAEntityManager.createDynamicQuery(QueryDefinition dynamic)
      Create an executable query from a dynamically defined query.
      OpenJPAQuery EntityManagerImpl.createDynamicQuery(QueryDefinition qdef) 

    • Uses of QueryDefinition in org.apache.openjpa.persistence.query

      Subinterfaces of QueryDefinition in org.apache.openjpa.persistence.query 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DomainObject
      Domain objects define the domain over which a query operates.
      Classes in org.apache.openjpa.persistence.query that implement QueryDefinition 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractDomainObject
      Domain Object is a path expression over which query is evaluated.
      class  EntryExpression
      Denotes ENTRY(e) on a path.
      class  FetchPath
      Denotes a path used in fetch join.
      class  JoinPath
      Path resulting by joining from a parent path via an attribute.
      class  KeyExpression
      Denotes KEY(e) Expression.
      class  OperatorPath
      A path resulting from KEY() or VALUE() operation on an existing path.
      class  QueryDefinitionImpl
      Implements QueryDefinition.
      class  RootPath
      Denotes root domain instance representing a persistent type.
      class  ValueExpression
      Denotes VALUE(e) Expression.
